value: If any “ if ”  condition is false then an “else” statement comes into the picture.

title: will add later
text:
var a = 10;
var b = 12;
if(a > b){
 console.log(a," is greater than ",b);
}
else {
 console.log(b," is greater than " ,a);
}

value: In this example if a condition is false. So, else statement will execute

title: will add later
value:
var num1= 10;
var num2 = 20;

if(num1>num2){
 connsole.log("num1 is greater than num2");
}
else{
 console.log("num2 is greater than num1");
}

The condition that we given num1> num2 is false because num1 (10) is not
 greater than num2(20), So, if condition is false it will go to else condition
 and print the
 num2 is greater than num1.
